column4: can anyone help me with ssh.. im going nuts here. no matter what i try its always the same thing client - ssh to server = asking for passw <-- and I dont knwo the passw = permission denied
what username are you using?
on the server? nothing I guess, i never created one
so how do you expect to log on? :) you need a valid user on the server to be able to log on (ssh or otherwise)
all the guies/tutorials i followed says the samething login to your remote, but everytime I do that, its always asking for a passwd, so i can never finish a tutorial, i cant get past the passw thing
is this a server you setup?
do you have a good guide i can use?
im trying to ssh from my main os - kubuntu (client) into my guest os (vmare-gentoo)
well, setup a user in the vmware-gentoo install and then use that user with ssh
im not there yet, i have no userspace, im trying to compile gentoo from scratch, but i need to be able to ssh into gentoo so i can copy and paste
any ideas or better a guide ?

you've got a catch 22 then .. without a valid user, you can't log on .. has a root account been created on the gentoo install yet? i'm not very familiar with gentoo's phases, but i am pretty sure a root account is created on phase 1
this is a gentoo issue you're asking about in #ubuntu -- you will have to ask someone who knows about gentoo .. in #gentoo perhaps ..
but its not related to gentoo since i havent actually built gentoo
im just a noob, i guess i have to read on
it is a gentoo issue if you're trying to ssh into a partial build of gentoo ..
oh okay
thats too bad, because im not joining #gentoo, I did it once and ive never seen such hostility towards noobs
thanks anyways
i'm sorry we can't help here, we only support ubuntu
no its my fault.. im using irssi and I actually thought I was in #linux but it turns out im on ubuntu, my apologies :)
